Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: nickcwest
Reviews.Content: Overall I'd really recommend this place as a budget boutique hotel. First off the location is excellent, just off the Ramblas at the port end, 30 seconds from the splendour of Placa Real. First impressions on walking into the place were really impressive. The reception is modern and sleek but mixed in with some exposed old brickwork behind modern clean glass. All very well lit and quite striking. There's a glass door through to a bar next door that I assume is owned by the same people and well worth a visit for tapas and a drink. The room (506) was modern, 22" TV with international channels (BBC1 and ITV1 which was a bonus and meant I could watch Match of the Day), very impressive "wet room" with large shower area and modern sink etc. We had a balcony but facing an inner courtyard it wasn't somewhere to spend much time. Only there for 2 nights we didn't have much occasion to bother the staff but they seemed pleasant enough, the room was cleaned as expected and overall I'd recommend the place at the price we paid, which was about £75 a night. Also recommend the restaurant directly opposite, I forget the name but it was big, bustling and really good value. A bottle of Albarino was 14 euro and the most expensive on the list, a steak and chips (not that the Spanish can ever master chips; it's the olive oil you see) was 11 euro. Expect to pay double that and more elsewhere for substandard fare. Having not been to Spain for a few years I must say I was staggered by how the prices have rocketed. Even the most basic plate of tapas is now 3 euro (they used to be free!), with most coming in at 5-7 euro. A glass of local beer (300ml) now routinely costs almost 4 euro. That's about 150% increase on just 5 years ago, in a country where the government take only a fraction of the duty they do in the UK. A vodka coke in a normal bar (inside) cost 7 euro. Again a huge mark up. They're the sort of prices that will probably make me and many others think twice about going back in future, and as Spain teeters on the edge of financial oblivion, the last thing it needs to do is drive away tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Few frills, but pleasant, modern, and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: auros
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel my spouse and I stayed in over our honeymoon, and it was a pleasant place to arrive after more than 24 hours of continuous travel (flights from San Francisco to Philadelphia to Madrid, high-speed rail to Barcelona, taxi to hotel). The decor is spare, but has some whimsy (such as the glass elevator in a shaft illuminated with UV light, which has a giant metal fish as its counterweight). Our room was comfortable, and the hotel was in a convenient central location relative to many of the places we wanted to visit. One negative point: We both have long hair, and with the towels being somewhat small, we needed a couple extras. The maids seemed determined, on every visit, to take all the towels, and leave us with only two again, even though we were hanging the towels up and a card said that if you hung them they would be left for reuse. (They were only supposed to take towels if you left them on the floor.) A couple of mornings it took quite a long time to get somebody to bring us the towels; on one of them we just gave up and got dressed damp.

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel handy for all sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: lachicaReading
Reviews.Content: We loved this boutique hotel for the friendly, helpful staff, lovely clean, quiet room but most of all for its position. Within a few meters of the Ramblas, in the Gothic district, it was an easy stroll to a variety of restaurants, to the Metro, shops and of course La Rambla. Rene on reception was very helpful and knowledgeable. Some reviewers have said it's noisy, so we asked for a room at the back, on a high floor, and our room had a balcony overlooking an internal courtyard and we didn't find it at all noisy even though the hotel was busy. It was spotless and had a lovely modern bathroom with all you need for a short break. The bonus of a high room is the ride in the lift - even if you have a ground floor room, check out the lift that's furthest from Reception. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms, so you might want to take a travel kettle. There is an all hours mini market a few yards away, and a variety of bars/restaurants offering breakfasts. The hotel does offer breakfast but we didn't try it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Party People”
Reviews.Author: C D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on last Monday, Goods: * Brilliant location it is literally on las Ramblas * Shops 2 min walk, bars & pubs on the same street as hotel * brilliant shower * very clean ( cleaned everyday ) *Friendly staff *Free Safe *Wi-Fi * Had Hair Dryer, Razor, Shampoo, Shower gel, comb, Soap & Towels Bads: * Small Room * Lighting was terrible in room- ( bathroom was only bit of light) * terrible bed * Air Con for Warm Air didnt work (got quite cold) * Very Nosey at night (requested a High Floor got room in 100's street is crazy at night so heard everything) Over all it is a lovely hotel and Very Modern perfect for 2 night stay for young couples who wants to party Hen/Stag Parties as close to everything :) would not reccomend to families or older couples

Reviews.Title: “Good location, goom size room”
Reviews.Author: zarah s
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying in this hotel, and have nothing but praises. Excellent location no breakfast facilities but loads of restaurants and cafe nearby. The room was cleaned daily, the hotel has a bar in the night that serves tapas and drinks for a reasonable prices. WIFI available in the room and english channels on room TV. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very good location just off Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: jackslybacon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a Barcelona city break and found the location very good. The room was quite small, but was cleaned each day. The reception staff were helpful and stored our luggage in a safe location on the day we were returning to N Ireland. Easy walking distance to Barcelona Port, World Trade Centre, La Sagrada Familia, Gaudi Museum and Plaza de Catalonia. All in all, a great place for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: wendybob a
Reviews.Content: Excelent location but very noisy. Breakfast could have been better, food never warm enough. The rooms were clean and tidy. Too expensive for the service rendered.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but with its pitfalls.”
Reviews.Author: BIGJC99
Reviews.Content: We were on a 2 night break in Barcelona and booked this hotel as it was inexpensive and seemed to have a good location. The location was excellent, just off Las Ramblas, towards the bottom end, it really was an ideal starting point for exploring Barcelona. The rooms were clean and although the amenities were very basic, it had everything you would want if you intend to use your hotel as a base. The hotel is fairly recently renovated and this showed in the decor, a quite stylish reception area, a glass lift, and murals on the wall. This is where the positives stop unfortunately. Barcelona in January is fairly mild, however it is still a bit chilly on an evening. The bedding provided was inadequate to say the least, the first night I was cold. The room was supposed to have heating, and there was a control and thermostat for this on the wall. The heating did not work, I mentioned this to the reception for them to pull open a panel, press something on a touch screen and tell us it should now be ok, it made no difference, I complained again and they did the same thing, again, it made no difference. Also there was no hot water, having been on an open top bus for the big chunks of the day we were cold to say the least, having to face a cold shower was not ideal. The last thing worth mentioning was the noise. This didnt really bother me as I knew from the location there would be some. However as we were on the first floor and the street was quite a busy thoroughfare it was very noisy, it only got quite around 6am. It was nothing too bad, people having fun on their way home that sort of thing. If youre the sort of person who likes a bit of peace, then this is not the place for you. In short, the hotel had an excellent location, it was cheap, but if youre going to consider it in the winter months, take thick pyjamas and some ear muffs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! Perfect for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: josh O
Reviews.Content: As a group of five 21 year old lads, our requirements for a hotel were not exactly extensive. Saying this, the first impression was fantastic! Very modern design inside and out, The rooms are everything you need. extremely clean, spacious, equipped with lots of storage, and good lighting. The rooms come with satellite tele, a safe to keep all your valuables (strongly advised), large bathroom with a powerful shower, huge mirrors as well as complimentary toiletries. We stayed in a triple and a twin. The triple was facing the street and although we were partying deep into the night, the noise of midday hustle did not wake us once. The twin room located in the middle of the hotel was silent with the exception of slight hallway noise. Hotel Staff: I could not praise the hotel staff highly enough. They all speak perfect English and any questions we had about the city, local restaurants, or even places to avoid they were more than happy to answer. They are more than welcoming to guests of all ages and are always up for a chat about the stories you have already gathered in your time in Barcelona. Out of courtesy we were even given a book of discount vouchers when asking about some good deals around the city too. The Location: Perfect on the south end of La Rambla, about a 10/15 minute walk in straight line from the Aerobus Bus stop as well as very close to several Metro stops. a taxi rank is perfectly located a few minutes walk away by the monument, however a number of the tourist attractions are within walking distance of the hotel (30/40 minutes) highly recommended with great designer stores and architecture along the way. The port is a stones throw away and is again a great walk along the beach down to some of the best bars and clubs. It's in the heart of all the action - we passed many hotels we were considering before we arrived and on reflection for a decent buzz of night life, good restaurants right outside the door and good transport connections Barcelona House is the only place you'll want to stay. La Rambla is a little seedy in early hours, with a large amount of prostitutes and pick pocketers. However, please do not let this deter you, just keep your valuables in a secure pocket and stay sober enough to stay standing and you'll be fine. As long as you do this, you can just say "no" and walk on or stay and have some funny banter with them. The only other thing I would advise is that to stick to main streets at night and not to kick off if you suspect someone has stolen your money. (We saw a group of guys find out the hard way). Tip: Rooms do not come with an iron, although front desk will supply you with one upon request. Only 1 key per room so it's advised to leave it at the front desk each time leaving the hotel. Absolutely perfect for a 5 night stay. More than a pleasure. P.s. Apologies for waking anyone up at 6am with our return each morning!

Reviews.Title: “cold and noisy”
Reviews.Author: ColinAstley
Reviews.Content: very cold, and heating did not work. noisy all day and night (must have been next door to a young group). electric box buzzed all night found hotel staff very unhelpful, appart from spanniard on desk in mornings who was great. constantly felt like we were being watched. apart from that location was perfect, and was a stones throw away from la ramblas. If you are going for a short stay it was ok, but couldnt stay there for a week

Reviews.Title: “Please don't use this place!”
Reviews.Author: dancehotsalsa
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place is the location, but this obviously means noise, I just didn't realise how much noise! They did move use after the first night but even then jazz music was still audible, even through having ear plugs in! The breakfast if you can call it a breakfast was crap! Frosties, a croissant or a bread roll, to me is not a breakfast! The room was pleasant enough but freezing so I asked to have the heating on was told there was a law that the rooms had to be at a certain temperature! Fine in the middle of summer but not in December! The beds are ready for collapsin, and my husband had to be really careful! There is no kettle, no mini bar, in rooms, but it was cold enough that the San Miguel stayed cold without a fridge! My advice is if you are bothered by noise don't use this place

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Tina B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona House hotel mid October with our 14 year old son in a triple room. The room was at the back of the hotel, no street noise and the room was clean and large enough for the three of us. The staff on the front desk were helpful, and when we needed to check out hours before our flight left we could leave our baggage in the luggage room. Plenty of places nearby to grab breakfast/lunch/dinner at! You are fantastically positioned to explore Barri Gotic, and we spent hour after hour exploring the medieval streets - highly recommended. The hotel was clean and tidy - our only LITTLE critisism was that as the floors are all laminate, sounds travels along the corridor, through the rooms, and it can get a little noisy when people come back late. This certainly did not spoil our break though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good area, Will stay Again”
Reviews.Author: lindsay a
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel and anyone worried about previous comments need not be. In an excellent location just off Ramblas. Front Desk staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. Rooms were spotless, spacious and very modern (rooms overlooking the street can be noisy but hey this is a city after all) Bars, shops and restaurants surround the area and are very good standards. I will definitely stay again and recommend to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, good location right off La Rambla but very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in excellent location just off La Rambla. Rooms are modern, clean and basic. We stayed there for 3 nights and didn't get clean sheets they just came in and made beds and cleaned. This hotel is very noisy so if you stay here try and get a room at the back. I went with my 5 month old baby and I was told every room had a kettle in but they don't so I had to go and buy a travel kettle so I could boil my little girls water and they were not willing to help. They do have luggage room where you can leave your bags after check out. Overall its not a bad hotel but I don't think I'd stay there again but for the price you pay it's fine for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, friendly and quiet in the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TGeir
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just off the Ramblas. It's got very modern decor. The rooms are not huge but they are clean and the beds have good mattresses. We had a double room facing the middle courtyard which was nice and quiet. The drawback was that there wasn’t much of a view. For the price you pay I think this is as good as it possibly can get. The location is superb – you can get everywhere easily and you have a fantastic restaurant just opposite the hotel. We strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - but Barcelona stinks!”
Reviews.Author: jolup
Reviews.Content: Before commenting on the hotel I would mention that wherever you go in Barcelona, at least in the older parts of town, there is a distinct smell of sewage. It is noticable even on top of the sightseeing buses and seems to emanate from the numerous rain-water drains. I suppose you would get used to it eventually. As to the hotel: Pros: * very good location, 50 m to the Rambla and 100 m to the main square * very nice and helpful staff, esp the morning to noon receptionist * very clean rooms (although I cannot understand how the cleaning lady survives the intense chlorine smell from her cleaning fluid!) * outside street surprisingly peaceful considering the location - only utility traffic * a very good restaurant right across the street - a nice change from tapas! * WiFi worked fairly well in our room Neutral: * no breakfast facilities at the hotel, but several good alternatives within 50 m Con: * no minibar or refrigator in our room (# 402) * noisewise you are at the mercy of the other guests as the sound insulation appears to be non-existent - in fact the whole building seems to conduct noise disgustingly well! * no shelf in the shower/bathtub

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very modern rooms! Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: brookie0079
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 4 nights at Barcelona House, before I arrived I didnt expect much with it only being a 2 star but i was very pleasantly suprised; the hotel is lovely very new and the rooms were perfect. Absolutely spotless everywhere, walking to the hotel from La Rambla looks a bit dodgey but we soon realised all the streets in Barcelona looked like this! We never felt uncomfortable about walking around the small streets or anything! The hotel has no facilities at all so bare that in mind and call at the supermarket 2 mins away for anything you may need, there are a huge array of cafes, restaurants etc within minutes of the hotel! The receptionists cannot do enough for you so just ask! Overall a perfect city break, my only comment would be prepare to spend as everything is expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, funky hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kamonkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Fiesta de la Merce which is one of the main festivals in Barcelona. The location is awesome, in the old city, just off Las Ramblas. The hotel is surrounded by little streets with cool shops, cafes, bars, churches, placas, everything you can imagine. The area can get a bit crazy at night, but we didn't hear a peep once the very big windows were closed. The room was huge, with a big window opening onto a little terrace area. The bathroom was also huge, and nicely done. The hotel was quite funky, and the staff all spoke fluent English. Slightly let down by the cleaning staff - a few things were forgotten or missed during the cleaning, including leaving their cleaning cloths on the floor of the bathroom. But overall a good experience, and definitely great value for money. If you want to be in the thick of things, and like a bit of space, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, will 100% use if in Barca again”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: With this being one of my first experiences of booking a holiday and having to sift through the countless reviews of countless hotels, I was delighted with the room we settled on by the first night. Basically if you book this hotel I'd be very surprised if you come out disappointed. Good value for money, nice decor, good location, had a really cool lift as well, (as dumb a reason to judge as that sounds I'm just trying to get across it's a very well presented place! and that lift was cool..) can't really say many bad things about it. Was pleased with the room, nice modern design; cool dim blue light, easy-to-use safe, it wasn't the biggest but that's barely a complaint, just a detail - spacious enough for the price and Barcelona shouldn't be a place where you spend half your time indoors anyway. Proper nice bathroom too. The one gripe was in our double room the bed was two twins put together, but that was a minor. The location is perfect, there were couple hotels we'd looked at beforehand thinking they were at the heart of the city, but we realised in passing them throughout the week that Hotel Barcelona is (in my opinion anyway) one of the best located you'll find. The actual street it's on can look a bit seedy at times but there was never an issue of safety for us. Barcelona in general is the same as any major tourist city, if you know how to look after yourself and keep aware of your belongings you'll have no problems at all. The hotel was also, besides La Ramblas itself, surrounded by nice restaurants (i.e the square with a very good Pizzeria and other things just down the road) and within reach of every major attraction. People at the desk were helpful enough, wasn't the most personal of weeks with the staff but again, minor. Oh and no hotel breakfast could be a bit irritating but there's plenty of places about.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect for a short city trip!”
Reviews.Author: Simone1407
Reviews.Content: Its a small hotel, very central located (next to placa reial and rambla), but quiet. looks a little bit like a boutique hotel. a very modern cool style, the rooms are clean with cheap but modern design and not too small like in other cheap hotels. there is no minibar and not much space for cloth etc but for a 2 night-overnight stay its really simply perfect. we ordered a quiet room - the view was of course therefore not very nice , but who cares if you just sleep there. the walls of the rooms are quite thin, but the hotel is very quiet as really cool and normal pleople stay there, it was not very noisy at all. the staff is young, hip ,very friendly and helpful. there is a storage for luggage as well. it doesn´t have a restaurant, but for breakfast you can go just around the corner to the great placa reial and in the evening its much more fun to go to a restaurant somewhere at the harbour which is also just 10 min walking distance. for airport transfer you just have a 10 min. walk through rambla from /to placa de catalunya, where the aerobusses arrive/leave every 5 Minutes from/to airport (30 min). the barcelona city tour busses (hop on/hop off) are leaving 10 min walking distance from port vell at the end of rambla. i am a travel agent and i know a lot of hotels in barcelona, but this is the best for a short city trip. we originally wanted to book a luxury hotel (w-hotel) first, but it doesn´t make any sense at all if you do a lot of sightseeing, go out in the evening and don´t really have time to use the facilities of a expensive luxury hotel therefore (restaurant, pool , beach, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, we love it and will be back.”
Reviews.Author: qcw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night in this hotel after the cruise. We want to spend an extra day in Barcelona. This house is very convenient, one minute walking to the famous La Rambla. If you are not looking for a luxury hotel, just need something clean, nice, convenient and not expensive, this hotel is a perfect choice. Since our cruise ship arrive 7am, we got to the hotel about 8 am. We left our luggages in their storage room, then we were free to go for a tour. We came back in the evening to check-in. The hotel is relative small. It usally only has one people in the front desk. He is very nice. He let me use his computer to online check-in my flight. I highly recommand this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action, but average at best”
Reviews.Author: 155019Happytraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Barcelona is just a few steps from Ramblas and also very close to the cruise ship piers. Upon our early morning arrival our room was not ready which is what we had expected, but they were happy to store our luggage for the day so we could tour this beautiful city. The gal at the front desk suggested one of those double decker bus tours and sold us tickets at a reduced rate. This ended up being a really great way to get in as much as possible during our short stay in Barcelona. The hotel itself fell a little short of comfortable. The beds & pillows were terrible, and we knew we were in for a very long, sleepless night. The lighting in the room was also really poor. My husband could hardly see to shave. The noise seemed to carry as we heard other guests coming and going throughout the night. Not a winner for us, but great location for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Clean, Helpful Staff, Good Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: LouiB
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern hotel, just off the Ramblas. Room small but well designed so not claustrophobic. Quiet , comfortable bed/pillows, great bathroom, helpful staff. Overslept so can't comment on breakfast. Very good value and short stroll to metro.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_A_24
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barcelona is located just off Las Ramblas making it an ideal place to stay for seeing all the main attractions of Barcelona. There is a Metro stop just round the corner, and many of the attractions, including the beach, are within walking distance. The hotel was cheap and clean, the rooms had air con, tv and a good sized bathroom with a powerful shower and plenty of hot water for 3 girls to get ready for a night out! Staff were friendly and spoke very good English. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: geekamedia
Reviews.Content: Hotel was basic. Walls were thin, we could here our neighbours coming in at 4am everymorning. this was the only let down for this hotel. However we did ask for a double bed and was given rather unstaible twin beds. Staff were excellent and really friendly, would help you with anything The hotel was in an ideal location, 5 seconds from ramblas, close to bars, shops and restaurants. Would stay again if we were going with friends but as a couple we would stay in more of a swanky hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Travel lodge facilities, great location”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: This could have been a been a great hotel if not for quite frankly for making cuts in all the wrong places (as detailed in the previous reviewers post). The location is the hotels only saving grace. Customer service was quite good with all questions answered promptly and service requests completed in good time. A tip, do not pay for the €4 breakfast in the hotel next door as it is disgusting!!! just find a local cafe nearby, there are a number of them about. Slowest internet speed I have encountered to date. I would not stay at this hotel again, I would just pay a bit more per night and enjoy the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and perfect located”
Reviews.Author: edol
Reviews.Content: We had booked the hotel through internet, after visiting it before on a busines trip. The location is perfect to visit the city. Our room with 2 beds was modern and brand new. That one of our friends with a double bed was also new, but smaller and a little tight. Their shower was not working well, but in our room everything was okay. The reception people were very polite and helpfull. The price was not cheap, but okay for what was offered. I will come back in October with some other friends and I can recommendate this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel's money-saving tactics are very intrusive”
Reviews.Author: trpng0bily
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three nights with a friend and the hotel refused to give us a second key "for security reasons." Since you need the key to a) access the elevator which is the only way onto the guest floors, and b) turn on the electricity in the room, having only one key meant that one person couldn't stay in the room while the other went out, b/c either the one who went out wouldn't be able to get back upstairs, or the one who stayed in wouldn't have electricity in the room. This is a very strange and off-putting way for them to save on their electricity bill, and I wouldn't recommend this hotel for that reason alone unless you are traveling by yourself. Another little money saving thing they do is to turn off the air conditioning for most of the day and night, which can get unpleasant when its hot out. And not to be a stickler, but the balcony that I was told my room had was actually just a window that they elaborated to me is considered a balcony because it is large enough to lean out of for a smoke. The place looks much nicer from the pictures than it actually is. On the plus side, the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, cold rooms”
Reviews.Author: twill_ambition
Reviews.Content: the hotel seems very new, it has a nice location - in the barrio gotico just of the ramblas and has free wifi internet (not very fast) and nice restaurant and supermarkets nearby. room are small size and with little/no amenities. windows are not sound-proof as in most 4* hotels. hence it can be noisy. the biggest issue was the room temperature which was very cold, much colder than the actual outside temperature. it did not depend on the A/C which was off.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: karenc46
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend this hotel. The location is great, just off la rambas and near the harbour. I went with another 7 girls for a birthday treat and had a great time. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms lovely and clean with free safety deposit box, hair dryer, toiletries, good shower, tv. wish it had a better light in the bathroom for makeup but thats the only very small comlplaint. For the price we paid I would certainly use this hotel again. check out the icebar and Opium nightclub on the beach and Milk bar for cocktails and ( a couple of hours later) brunch, fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value, great location, delightful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Scottben01
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our short stay here. The hotel was perfect for our needs. We usually stay in 4 or 5 star hotels so I was nervous about this but it really was ideal. Clean, bright, modern and a fab location. We had a family room which was very large. Bathroom was lovely and toiletries were fab. All in all, would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: Lea21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice, very close to the main street - Ramblas. The room was small but clean and comfortable. Staff were very polite and helpfull. There are lots of pubs, bars and restaurants in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: bguf5
Reviews.Content: Barcelona house is a great hotel on a budget. It's a bit wacky and the lifts are just amazing (glass lifts in a lift shaft splattered with UV paints!). In the bedrooms the UV light strip above the bed was a bit weird, there was a huge balcony overlooking the air conditioning system and the toilet has a frosted glass door which isn't really to our taste (we like a private bathroom!). On the other hand the shower was fantastic, the room clean and the hotel felt very safe and comfortable. You're right in the centre of everything and my boyfriend and I just walked everywhere. Leaving bags with them because of an early arrival was no problem at all either. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to explore Barcelona on a budget and just needs a nice, safe, clean hotel to sleep in but not spenda lot of time in.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Decor, Excellent Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BlackPear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a narrow pedestrian street 100 metres from The Ramblas and within walking distance of the port and two metro stations. No food is provided, but there are lots of places to eat within a short stroll. We needed one night before our cruise sailed and this fitted the bill very well. We found the best deal on octopustravel.co.uk Recently refurbished, this old building now feels very modern and trendy. The rooms were really nice, Views from the windows vary - ours was a view of the backs of other buildings but our daughter's looked over the street below. Staff were helpful and we could store luggage after we checked out of our rooms. If you want a full service hotel with restaurant, go elsewhere, but for a clean, comfortable room and a good night's sleep close to the city centre and port, Barcelona House would be hard to beat and is competitively priced.

Reviews.Title: “Hi-Tech-Style iside Old building”
Reviews.Author: PolinaKaulio
Reviews.Content: It was a big surprise, when we came into. You pay about 80 Euro and you get fully equiped modern-style double room with free wi-fi (if you live at the 1st or 2nd floor), lcd-tv, hairdryer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kvgiedre
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise. Brilliant location, simple, but nice interior, clean and very spaciuos room. The only downsides I would point - the room was quite dark & the walls were pretty thin, sound isolation could have been much better. However, I would definetely return back. Despite the minuses mentioned - no doubt it's good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trendy hotel - lovely rooms but avoid the noisy side”
Reviews.Author: Yorkylass82
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - looks like its been refurbished recently and to a really nice standard - safe in the room which is brilliant for anyone worrying about the pickpocket warnings. Only downside is the thin walls which wasnt really a major problem but check on arrival that your room isnt one of those above the nightclub or you will hear noise. Reastaurant accross from the hotel is fantastic but you may have to queue to get in, shortest wait time is when it first opens after that queue got much longer. Hotel is lovely and central and within a minute or so walk to a lovely square with lots of restaurants - couple of the alleys nearby felt a tad dodgy at night but if you stuck to the main road and then just the alley the hotel was on it was always fine.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: cliodhnab1
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 girlfriends stayed here for 3 nights at the start of October. The hotel is really trendy and the rooms are spacious. The location is great down an alley off La Ramblas. The alley was a little dodgy if you wandered to far down but is absolutely fine if you are just using it to walk up to La Ramblas. The staff weren't very friendly but that didn't matter to us as we only used the hotel to sleep. There was no tea & coffee making facilities in the room which would have been nice. Overall, the location was great and the price very reasonable. Great place to stay if you want to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: antc
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Barcelona House for 5 days. Overall, since it was recently built, it is beautiful and very modern, clean, etc. We stayed in a room for 3 which had 3 single beds. Room was a decent size and bathroom was great. The only thing I would improve on is: More mirrors (only mirror is in bathroom and is not the biggest) and more lighting. (Just one recommendation: Have a backup for wake-up calls...not too reliable). Location is amazing - right off La Rambla. And even though the hotel is in a tiny little alley-like street, it is very busy and loud (which we didn't mind because in Barcelona you party with the rest of them!)

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, clean, and modern.”
Reviews.Author: TnTster
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms here for myself and my husband and the other for my parents. We stayed in Room 306, which is right off the elevator. Room was very clean and modern. But the walls are really thin, bed was a bit shaky, the room size was pretty small, but stay-able for a close couple. Nice flat screen tv. The front desk staff was very kind and hospitable. We liked Rene especially. I chose this hotel based on its pictures which are true to real life. It’s very close to La Rambla (1 min) and Placa Reial (1 min) and Bocqueria (5 min), which means many people walk by all the time. It can be noisy and crowded outside, but from the room, I did not hear the streets at all. Just the people next door (very thin walls). Also, the hotel is very close to the Barri Gothic where you should get lost and explore the small cobblestone streets and charming alleyways. I wished I could have spent more time here. If you venture left from the hotel at night, you might see people selling cans of beer for 1euro. We walked to the left for a bit but decided to turn around because it felt sketchy. No breakfast, but there’s a nice bakery down Carrer de la Ferran (where the McDonald’s is at) called Forn del Pi. The liquor store and markets are just 1-2 minutes away. And there are plenty of restaurants that cater to tourists on La Rambla. I recommend Romesco (which is off the beaten path on Calle Sant Pau, 28) for made-to-order seafood dishes that’s affordable and many locals dine here. My parents went here 3 nights in a row! Complaints: I requested a wake up call one day and didn’t get it the next day (not a good sign, especially if you had to make it to the airport the next morning). Also, my parents were in Room 311 and they could definitely hear the street noises and late night drunkards. Room 311was a decent size but was not enough room for their only one big luggage. They had to somehow place it in the middle of the room and made it a bit tight. Also, the air conditioning did not work properly. They asked the front desk twice about it, in which they responded “we checked downstairs and it seems to work,” which didn’t. Overall, I would stay here again because of the location and cleanliness, but it wouldn’t hurt looking for something elsewhere. There’s so much in Barcelona to see that I don’t think I necessary need to just stay in the La Rambla area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city centre location”
Reviews.Author: will0w19
Reviews.Content: Just off La Rambla at the Port end which is an ideal city centre location. Plenty of lovely shops, cafes and restaurants nearby. La Fonda restaurant, three steps across from front door is really nice and also very reasonable. The bar at the wax museum, just round the corner is also worth a visit and isn't too expensive. the only down side was the setting of the air conditioning in the hotel. was far too hot some nights but was set centrally at reception. would definately stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location- we recommend :)”
Reviews.Author: FinTravelette
Reviews.Content: I checked hotel alternatives from web before we decided to book one. I noticed that latest reviews mostly recommended this hotel in Trip Advisor, so did the reviews in Booking.com. The hotel met the expectations we had: good value for money in great location. We stayed four nights in this hotel. The service was good in the reception. We had possibility to choose the room from different alternatives ( room with twin beds and window towards the street or room with double bed and window towards the inner yard). We chosed the quiet room with double bed in fourth floor. The room was really silent, I did't have to use ear plugs at all, I usually use ear plugs in hotels!! Only one minus in the room; the sewer smelled little bit. A couple from Finland, returing to Barcelona next year :)

Reviews.Title: “Place to start Barcelona exploring”
Reviews.Author: Elena_B_2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in Ciutat Vella district very close to La Rambla - the main tourist street of Barcelona with it's famous market Boqueria. Barri Gotic and the port of Barcelona are also within walking distance. The staff of the hotel was really helpful - arranged taxi and informed us that the nearby streets are a bit dangerous for walking in the evening/night because of cases of robbery. So we were cautious and nothing bad had happened. Many thanks to this hotels for providing us a great base to start Barcelona exploring in May 2010. We were even lucky to see the celebration of the local holiday in Barceloneta district and enjoyed it's atmosphere very much.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Zenuine
Reviews.Content: despite the horrendous reviews from previous travellers, we decided to give it a try anyway, seeing that it was newly renovated. this place exceeded all our expectations. it had a great location just off la ramblas the main shoppping area, and was walkable to a great number of shops and restaurants in the barrie gothic. the room was big considering the price and location. imagine 3 girls with huge luggages. (we managed to each get a corner to put our bags and stuff!) the bathroom was spacious, with a shower that could have possibly fit all 3 of us if we had tried! and the water pressure, good. no trickle of occasionally hot occasionally cold water here! get a room away from the main street, and be blessed with uninterrupted sleep throughout the night, away from the hustle and bustle that make up the night life along la ramblas. very clean room. obviously newly renovated, and good security. there is a lift! important when u have lots of luggages, and access to it only with the hotel security room key which is important for safety. only gripe would be a lack of ventilation in the rooms, which could be solved by opening the window. most importantly, it was located directly opposite la fonda, which turns out to be the best restaurant you could have ever eaten in barcelona. both in value and quality of food.

Reviews.Title: “You could do worse...”
Reviews.Author: esskaykay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Feb 2003, for three nights. I managed to get a corner room, which is quite big, with plenty of room, and off the street too. The bathroom was absolutely fine, clean, and the shower was quite warm. The heating was on full blast, so we were boiling all night. It was absolutely fine to have as a base, why would you want to be sat in your hotel room when you're in Barcelona anyway?! The only problem I had with the place was that the walls were really thin, so we could hear people out in the corridor, and in the room next door to us, but it was fairly quiet during the night. The breakfast was okay, toast and coffee. I thought the staff were fine, the Spanish can be a bit brusque in manner anyway! Although I have to say that the staff in the adjoining bar/club were really rude, but if you ignore them, the actual place is quite quirky, the music is pretty good too, it gets really busy later on, and you don't have far to stagger home either. It's in a great location - I didn't feel at all worried about the area; compared with Central London at night, I felt much safer. Give Barcelona House a chance, it's a nice place really!!

Reviews.Title: “Roach city-beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If the smell of roach spray wasn't enough to make our stomaches turn, combined with the sight of roaches crawling on the bed and the walls did make us leave after the first night. Bugs aside, the colorful decor that the hotel is known for is actually a cheap way to hide the decrepit and dilapadated condition of the rooms, the furniture and the entire hotel. Beware...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst place I've ever stayed in all of my travels in Europe. It was tiny, dirty and across from one of the busiest restaurants on the street. I was up until 4am listening to patrons scream across the street. The bathroom was fithy and I would never eat in the tiny restaurant they have on site.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Gorgeous2000
Reviews.Content: May 2004 We stayed in familly room with two 8 year olds - #117 to be precise. Like others having read some of the reviews I was a bit concerned but choices can be limited when looking for a quad room so we went ahead and booked anyway. What a relief! We found it to be very clean, spacious - enough for the kids to play and not feel on top of us, refreshingly brightly coloured (makes a pleasant change) and ideally located. Couldn't ask for more really. Would highly recommend and re-book.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i went to Barcelona house for the first time , the first week on may 2004. the hotel is very nice. my bedroom was violet, like all my floor. it has been all ok. but one mornig i am waken up by two people that made sex near us. they sreamed very much. i'm sorry for my schoolastic english... bye

Reviews.Title: “not bad.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. The rooms are all different. My bathroom wasn't clean, but my friends was fine. Nice staff. Quite good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Who wants to stay in a hotel all the time!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona last week and found the hotel very clean and the staff very friendly, accommodating to our every need. We had a room overlooking the street of Escudellers and it was fairly busy and loud till 5 am in the morning what with the multitude of Celtic supporters staying on the street. The chanting was very creative and melodic!! Overall, the hotel was great for our needs...i.e. sleeping and bathing.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Barcelona House
HotelInfo.Address: Escudellers, 19, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
